intro: Jasione tristis subsp. ateridae, commonly known as the dark-flowered jasione, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and segmented fruits. The subspecies is distinguished by its dark purple to almost black flowers, which contrast with its slender, hairy stems. It typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. The plant has a compact growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds.
